alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 23 at 9:03PM CDT until September 23 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Western Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... East central Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 903 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Boynton to 2 miles northwest of Schulter to near Okfuskee, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Henryetta... Morris... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Council Hill... Hoffman... Preston... Okmulgee State Park... Hitchita... Pierce... Eram... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 232 and 262. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
